name: Woven Hut: Rhythmic Stripes
description: A hut made from a lightweight Ashen Aratiku Wood frame, perfectly sized to accommodate a small stall, that can be seen throughout Chuwen Fair.\nIn the eyes of many music-lovers in Natlan, everything in life has a "rhythm" of its own, goods and stalls being no exception. The clearer and more tangible this rhythm, the more likely it is to capture their attention and thus win their favor. Some merchants, therefore, have attempted to dye their stall awnings with striped patterns in an attempt to take advantage of this phenomenon. In practice, however, most people's attention tends to focus on the goods themselves, leaving the rhythmic effect unnoticed...
